TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to Provincial Deputation, 05-25-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 805

div1.p: Stephen F. Austin, To the Most Excellent Deputation of the Province of Texas.

I will at as early a time as possible, call together all the inhabitants of this District to inform them of Your Excellency's Dispositions, that they may if they should wish it give their instructions to the Representative, for the Government of his Conduct, and to enable him to obtain a relief to the declining State. I will inform Your Excellency of the result of the meeting.
God and Liberty—Town of San Felipe de Austin, May 25th 1824, 4-3.
